title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 921-4.1 - Transfers

N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 §§ 921-4.1 - Transfers

State Regulations
(a) Notice is not
required when: (1)

An employer offers to
transfer an employee to a different site of employment within a reasonable
commuting distance with no more than a six-month break in employment, regardless of whether the employee accepts such employment; or
(2)

An employer offers to transfer the
employee to any other site of employment regardless of distance with no more
than a six-month break in employment and the employee accepts within 30 days of
the offer or of the closing or layoff, whichever is later. (b) An offer of reassignment to a different
site of employment shall not be deemed to be an offer of transfer if the new
job otherwise constitutes a constructive discharge. (c) For purposes of this Part, reasonable
commuting distance is the distance an individual could be reasonably expected
to commute to their job and is determined solely for purposes of transfers. Reasonable commuting distance will vary with local conditions with
consideration given to the geographic accessibility of the place of work, the
quality of the roads, customarily available transportation, and the usual
travel time, provided however, in no event shall such distance exceed that
which can be reasonably traveled in one and one-half hours when the site of
employment is being moved to a location within the City of New York or on Long

Island, or one hour when the site of employment is being moved to any other
location in the state. Notes
